topic: Deep dive: _statistics standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _statistics standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Statistics Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of the enhancements and notable features of the statistics standard library module in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Enhancements to support more statistical functions and distributions.
Improved accuracy and efficiency of certain statistical computations.
New methods for handling missing data and outlier detection.
Integration with other numerical libraries, such as NumPy.

code_examples.code:
import statistics

mean = statistics.mean([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
median = statistics.median([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])

from statistics import ttest_ind

result = ttest_ind(data1, data2)
print('t-statistic:', result[0], '
p-value:', result[1])

version_notes: For earlier Python versions, use third-party libraries such as SciPy or Statsmodels.
caveats: While the statistics module offers a variety of useful statistical functions, it may not be suitable for complex or high-performance statistical computing tasks. In those cases, consider using more specialized libraries like NumPy or SciPy.
Always ensure to validate and preprocess your data before performing any statistical analysis.
